Posts.Content: Hi, I had my op in July and currently having chemo. I've bought some crop tops from asda but I found the seamless crop top from m&s the most comfortable and easiest to get on. I'm a size 36C and I bought a large which is perfect. Hope this helps and good luck!
Posts.Title: Recommendations on bras/ post op tops.

Posts.Content: Hi Sam, I'm having exactly the same as you, 15 sessions plus 8 boosters. I start tomorrow. I understood the boosters to the tumour area were because its an agressive tumour. Hope all goes well for you. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy boosters?

Posts.Content: Thanks GRANNY59 for the advice, will maybe try for a lady gp like you said to rule out any cervix issues, as i do have it on my mind a lot that something isn't right down there but too afraid to find out. I guess I'm fearing the worst.... X
Posts.Title: Pain during intercourse

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice seaspirit44, am booked in to see female gp on friday so will see what happens after that. I'm beginning to realise i need to be more proactive regarding my health and well being and if i dont speak about my problems then nobody can help. I'm getting there....x
Posts.Title: Pain during intercourse

Posts.Content: Ahem! Hi all, I'm wondering if anyone can help me as i can't talk to my oncologist and i can't get to see my gp. Since my fect chemo started august 2017 i haven't had pain free sex. My cancer is oestrogen based so limited with that. I looked on the forum some months back and bought the yes range moisturiser and lubricant but it doesn't help. When me & my partner try sex, within seconds i am red raw and screaming in agony! Not in a good way!  Is this the forever now? I am currently on herceptin and tamoxifen. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Pain during intercourse

Posts.Content: Hi just wanted to say thanks for all the support and advice, i feel a bit emotional at the moment, need to do some serious thinking..... Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Thanks Bonnyjules i won't be putting up with it any longer and i won't let that man cause me any more upset. I only wish I'd done it months ago. Time for a new chapter....x
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Youre absolutely right and I've already started the ball rolling! Had a meltdown, felt worn down and useless but after everyones healing comments i picked myself up off the floor and got proactive. We all deserve the best care possible. And I'm loving the image!
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi all, just to give you an update, i have got a new oncologist - Woohoo! Am sooo relieved :)) Thanks for all your support.
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Thank you Jane for your support, it feels better talking to you guys and knowing other people who have had a similar experience. I didn't like my consultant from day 1 but persevered because i believed it was just poor bedside manner but that he would help and advise when needed. How wrong was i!  With warm wishes and good luck to you. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Thanks Dreamthief and Leolady56 for your definitions of my consultant! Made me smile I had a bit of a meltdown this morning, he made me feel that bad about myself. But I've decided I'm not going to let pompous gits like him knock me down we have enough of a battle to win without people like him! I live in Leicester btw Leolady56. Like you said (and a friend of mine) if we don't speak up about poor care and treatment then nothing will change and this idiot will continue to give poor care to other people. I don't want anyone else to feel the way i did so i will be complaining for sure. Thank you for giving me the strength and support i needed. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Thanks ronstar for the advice like you during chemo i had bad PN with my fingers but it has now started with my feet 4 months later. My radiotherapy is going well so far no problems. I do feel like a sack of meat sometimes but i know all the nurses do their best to make us feel at ease and they do a fantastic job. Bless you for your kind words and support, it means so much. Tracey x
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi all, just looking for some advice. I went to see my oncologist consultant today as i was advised by my herceptin nurse and the chemo nurses. I am having problems with peripheral neuropathy and wanted some advice and my herceptin nurse suggested pyridoxine a vitamin b6. But my consultant dismissed everything i said, didn't offer any help or advice and basically said these side effects are to be expected. He then asked if i was back at work yet and when i said no he said "oh you're skiving then" I came out feeling humiliated and very angry! I am now awake at 3am thinking i do not want to see him again and change consultant but i dont know how easy this is, has anyone else changed oncologist? I am left feeling more bereft and alone than ever even though I've got so far and now in radiotherapy and apart from the herceptin and tamoxifen I'm nearly finished treatment. Any advice would be helpful.
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?
Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Good luck to you too and sending a big hug for you
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi I hope it was good news but whatever the outcome please be assured we are all there with you and here for support. I filled up reading your message, my first annual mammogram is coming up soon and i can imagine how anxious you are feeling. Sending big hugs x
Posts.Title: First annual mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11, I too am er+ and her2+. I had a wle lumpectomy and slb in July 2017, finished few-T chemo in December, started herceptin Jan 1st (happy New year!) which is every 3 weeks for 12 months, full node clearance operation Jan 31st 2018, then radiotherapy, continuation of herceptin then tamoxifen for 5 years. The positive is that we are eligible for herceptin which appears to be a very good effective new drug. Good luck with your treatment, we are all there with you Tracey x
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive
